page.title: 10A RAG AND BONE MAN : HULL
page.content: Old Albie,as he is known locally,is very proud of his trade.He collects old washers,cookers,car exhausts- anything in fact that he can sell to the scrap merchant.For transport he uses a gaily painted cart,pulled by his horse,Ned.Both his father and grandfather owned the cart which in those days had metal rimmed wooden wheels instead of the car wheels he uses now. Albie tells of the times when he really collected rags and bones,giving pennies or balloons to the the children who eagerly listened for his call of "Rag'n bo".He says the bones used to be ground down and made into glue. Nowadays more and more unemployed people are trying to to earn money by scrap collecting in vans and even prams and he is glad to be retiring.
